705639f-a.text:
1820-1822 McDonald Ave., west side, south of Ave. P., showing the home of a Mrs. Rider, in 1873. The Robinson map of 1890 indicates this property as part of Ryder's Estate. The house is still standing in 1929.

April 1923.

Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
705639f-a.folder: McDonald Avenue & Avenue P, Brooklyn, NY

705640f-a.text:
(1)
McDonald Ave., east side, north of Ave. P., showing a southerly view of the home of D.D. Lake from 1860-1873. The Culver Line of the B.M.T. is also partially seen.
1922.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

(2)
The same, showing a front view.
April 1923.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
